item.title: Biden's Secret Weapon Against Trump: Older Voters
item.description: Senior citizens, long a reliable voting bloc for Republicans, are showing signs of turning into an election-year swing group, potentially giving President Biden an unlikely boost in his tough rematch against Donald Trump.

item.title: Oil Flat on Mixed Data From China
item.description: Oil prices were broadly stable as traders digested mixed data from top consumer China.

item.title: Russia Sets Hearing as It Moves Toward Secret Trial of Falsely Accused WSJ Reporter
item.description: A Russian court said judicial proceedings in the case of Evan Gershkovich would be held in secret, with the first hearing beginning on June 26.

item.title: Metal Prices Fall as Gold Slips on Dollar and Chinese Aluminum Production Rises
item.description: Base metals and gold futures fell as the dollar rose with investors weighing up the likelihood of fewer U.S. interest-rate cuts, given hawkish Fed commentary.

item.title: Dollar Has Scope to Rise as Markets Likely Price in Too Many U.S. Rate Cuts
item.description: There is room for U.S. interest-rate expectations to adjust higher which should help strengthen the dollar, Brown Brothers Harriman said.

item.title: China to Include Australia in Visa Waiver Program
item.description: China will include Australia in its visa waiver program, Premier Li Qiang announced after his meeting with Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, a sign of improving bilateral relations between the two countries.

item.title: UBS to Book $900 Million Provision on Funds Linked to Greensill
item.description: UBS said investors who accept the buyout offer will get 90% of the net asset value as at February 2021.

item.title: Finnish Insurer Sampo to Buy Topdanmark For $4.7 Billion
item.description: Sampo has agreed to buy Danish rival Topdanmark for $4.7 billion in an all-share deal, consolidating its position in the property and casualty insurance market.

item.title: Markets Continue to Focus on French Government Bond Performance
item.description: Eurozone bond market focus will firmly remain on the dynamics of French government bond yield spreads, Commerzbank Research said, as “several sessions of stabilization seem needed to calm nerves, but there is still no quick fix in sight.”

item.title: Nikkei Falls 1.8%, Dragged by Real-Estate Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks ended lower, dragged by falls in real-estate stocks, as uncertainty grew about the Bank of Japan’s policy outlook.

item.title: ING Outlines Mid-Term Targets
item.description: ING expects to grow its income and for its return on equity to rise in the mid-term, as the lender detailed its financial targets to 2027.

item.title: The Hostages Next Door: Inside a Notable Gaza Family's Dark Secret
item.description: To the outside world, they were a physician and a journalist. No one suspected their apartment had become a prison.

item.title: A Big Bond Rally Is Promising Some Help for Home Buyers
item.description: The sharp rise in bond prices has pushed down the yield on the 10-year U.S. Treasury note, a benchmark for mortgage rates and other borrowing costs across the economy.

item.title: Corporate Tax Rate Spurs Political Fight With More Than $1 Trillion at Stake
item.description: The two parties are trying to turn the 21% rate in opposite directions—with each percentage point worth more than $130 billion over a decade in tax revenue.

item.title: The Russian Spies Next Door
item.description: Posing as Argentine immigrants in Slovenia, the quiet married couple were in fact part of Putin’s aggressive effort to seed the West with “illegal” intelligence operatives, say authorities.

item.title: Express's assets will be folded into a new online retailing venture after a court approved the acquisition of the company's stores and clothing brands out of bankruptcy.
item.description: Express’s assets will be folded into a new online retailing venture after a court approved the acquisition of the company’s stores and clothing brands out of bankruptcy.

item.title: Russia said its security forces stormed a detention center in the city of Rostov-on-Don and killed six men linked to Islamic State who had taken two guards hostage at the facility.
item.description: Russia said its security forces stormed a detention center in the city of Rostov-on-Don and killed six men linked to Islamic State who had taken two guards hostage at the facility.

item.title: Wells Fargo is incurring financial losses on a credit card co-branded with Bilt after projections on key revenue drivers turned out to be inaccurate.
item.description: Wells Fargo is incurring financial losses on a credit card co-branded with Bilt after projections on key revenue drivers turned out to be inaccurate.

item.title: Signs of cooling inflation have driven a furious bond rally this month, boosting stocks to records and promising to inject some life into the listless housing market.
item.description: Signs of cooling inflation have driven a furious bond rally this month, boosting stocks to records and promising to inject some life into the listless housing market.

item.title: Crew members on a Greek-owned coal vessel were forced to abandon ship after Yemen's Houthi rebels launched an attack using a remote-controlled sea drone, according to the U.S. military said.
item.description: Crew members on a Greek-owned coal vessel were forced to abandon ship after Yemen’s Houthi rebels launched an attack using a remote-controlled sea drone, according to the U.S. military said.
